definition: ingrained habits are hard to overcome (idiom); bad old practices die hard

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing

sentences.english: That financial risks diehard of many private enterprises is the main cause toward their dooms.
sentences.chinese: 財務隱患的積重難返是很多民營企業走向末路的主因。

sentences.english: The reform of taxi industry, the front faces the dilemma of bad old practices die hard.
sentences.chinese: 出租車行業的改革，正面臨積重難返的困境。

sentences.english: These political difficulties are piled on top of cultural difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 這些政治刁難是由文化困境積重難返造成的。

sentences.english: The world economy is probably knackered, whatever we might do now.
sentences.chinese: 無論我們現在作何努力，世界經濟都很可能積重難返。
